body: This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/toxcore/13)

comment_regular_data.body:
Reviewed 1 of 3 files at r1, 2 of 2 files at r2.
Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, all discussions resolved.

---

_Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/13)_

<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->
I might be pointing out obvious, but Travis for this PR fails at tests.

Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 1 unresolved discussion, some commit checks failed.

---

_[auto_tests/tox_test.c, line 943 [r2]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/13#-KMSJyGi_olSnUpBjH9X:-KMSJyGi_olSnUpBjH9Y:634711410) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/1c78b9cc44b526eeff6f89aeef530d8816c593f5/auto_tests/tox_test.c#L943)):_

> ``` C
>         uint8_t dpk[TOX_PUBLIC_KEY_SIZE];
>         tox_self_get_dht_id(toxes[0], dpk);
>         TOX_ERR_BOOTSTRAP error = 0;
> ```

Why was this variable added? It's not used anywhere besides the call right following it. It's not even used in `tox_bootstrap()` two lines below it. Tthe other `tox_add_tcp_relay()`/`tox_bootstrap()` section you edited is not using error variable too, making the use of error values among  `tox_add_tcp_relay()`/`tox_bootstrap()` calls quite inconsistent.

---

_Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/13)_

<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->

That failure is due to group chats being fundamentally broken. It'll randomly work if I push a new commit. I suggest we drop that test from the suite for the time being. --- Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 1 unresolved discussion, some commit checks failed. --- _[auto_tests/tox_test.c, line 943 [r2]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/13#-KMSJyGi_olSnUpBjH9X:-KMSSJ94rGtbE5KdtN7T:-1591499670) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/1c78b9cc44b526eeff6f89aeef530d8816c593f5/auto_tests/tox_test.c#L943)):_
Previously, nurupo wrote… > Why was this variable added? It's not used anywhere besides the call right following it. It's not even used in `tox_bootstrap()` two lines below it. Tthe other `tox_add_tcp_relay()`/`tox_bootstrap()` section you edited is not using error variable too, making the use of error values among `tox_add_tcp_relay()`/`tox_bootstrap()` calls quite inconsistent. >
> This is just the first one I happen to fix. Once I got the error off this one, I fixed the 2nd without adding this var. In talking with @neduard we discussed that these tests are likely to be replaced with something different. So Putting in the time now to fix them, didn't make too much sense. Options are: Rewrite this, and the next, whole session to be more descriptive and verbose. (Likely the best option, and will be done at some point if not done now.) Quick fixup to make things more consistant. Ignore it because tests currently "work", and we're likely to replace them after completing the spec tests anyways. (What I had planned to do.) --- _Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/13#-:-KMSS_GGDbPCWn3Zusw-:822704534)_

Review status: 2 of 3 files reviewed at latest revision, 5 unresolved discussions.

---

_[.travis.yml, line 99 [r3]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/13#-KMV_zTzn9odQtNIWZmV:-KMV_zU-ZprehwEl4Gl1:-1768066031) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/fbcc00db209751449d2ce33f87720f8637d8d5e9/.travis.yml#L99)):_

> ``` YAML
> 
> notifications:
>   irc: "irc.freenode.net#toktok-status"
> ```

https://freenode.net/ says chat.freenode.net.

---

_[auto_tests/tox_test.c, line 5 [r3]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/13#-KMVa2EDdiXu2Q26RG-9:-KMVa2EDdiXu2Q26RG-A:-1796890903) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/fbcc00db209751449d2ce33f87720f8637d8d5e9/auto_tests/tox_test.c#L5)):_

> ``` C
>  * Tox Tests
>  *
>  * These tests required that no other Tox clients are running/accessable at
> ```

"require_"
"accessible on_"

---

_[auto_tests/tox_test.c, line 6 [r3]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/13#-KMVa96WNSNddNUe2lkN:-KMVa96Xsznj4nyFsGUN:1983407058) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/fbcc00db209751449d2ce33f87720f8637d8d5e9/auto_tests/tox_test.c#L6)):_

> ``` C
>  *
>  * These tests required that no other Tox clients are running/accessable at
>  * localhost. These test expect and the timeouts depend on the speed and size
> ```

"These tests*"
what do they expect?

---

_[auto_tests/tox_test.c, line 8 [r3]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/13#-KMVaJsYVeycROeVV-1A:-KMVaJsYVeycROeVV-1B:-1310903770) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/fbcc00db209751449d2ce33f87720f8637d8d5e9/auto_tests/tox_test.c#L8)):_

> ``` C
>  * localhost. These test expect and the timeouts depend on the speed and size
>  * of a private Tox network, trying to connect to outside clients will increase
>  * the length of time each test will take. Often surpassing a reasonable timeout
> ```

Remove "length of ". Replace ", trying to" with ". Trying to" and replace ". Often" with ", often". Add "." at end of sentence.

These tests expect, and the defined timeouts depend on the speed > ``` What do the tests expect? --- _[auto_tests/tox_test.c, line 36 [r5]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/13#-KOlGgXXSPYtiE1pCe73:-KOlGgXXSPYtiE1pCe74:b9vz7y4) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/c91acf5790cbb935befa6dd3bd1c6f5bc24cdec6/auto_tests/tox_test.c#L36)):_ > ``` C > > /* The Travis-CI container responds poorly to ::1 as a localhost address > * You're encouraged to -D FORCE_TESTS_IPV6 on a local test */ > ``` Perhaps it's better to invert this logic, so a local test exercises more by default, and on travis we disable some things that don't work well there. --- _[auto_tests/tox_test.c, line 1332 [r5]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/13#-KOlH9U9DrUQv1dyxfa5:-KOlH9U9DrUQv1dyxfa6:b-ibf6pz) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/c91acf5790cbb935befa6dd3bd1c6f5bc24cdec6/auto_tests/tox_test.c#L1332)):_ > ``` C > * new version of group chats for Tox already completed, and nearly ready to > * merge, No one is willing/available to give this test the time in needs */ > // DEFTESTCASE_SLOW(many_group, 140); > ``` Use `#if 0/#endif` instead to accommodate for source formatters. --- _Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/13)_

I added that below, where I think it fits better. --- _[auto_tests/tox_test.c, line 6 [r5]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/13#-KOlGtHxVaDrdpjqdJO7:-KOlIUAa242fu24mdsqN:b-p5kg46) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/c91acf5790cbb935befa6dd3bd1c6f5bc24cdec6/auto_tests/tox_test.c#L6)):_

> A small network size. If you connect to the global Tox Network, DHT traversing takes much longer than the timeouts are set for. --- _[auto_tests/tox_test.c, line 36 [r5]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/13#-KOlGgXXSPYtiE1pCe73:-KOlI03X-CFbOrosWP1j:ba56xh3) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/c91acf5790cbb935befa6dd3bd1c6f5bc24cdec6/auto_tests/tox_test.c#L36)):_
Previously, iphydf wrote… > Perhaps it's better to invert this logic, so a local test exercises more by default, and on travis we disable some things that don't work well there. >
> I can do that, but is' just localhost. It's only Travis that breaks ::1 while 127.0.1 works. On other systems both should work exactly the same. AFAICT there's no difference if you're system isn't ~broken. --- _[auto_tests/tox_test.c, line 1332 [r5]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/13#-KOlH9U9DrUQv1dyxfa5:-KOlHyR7q1ktg0LTXamN:b-896fix) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/c91acf5790cbb935befa6dd3bd1c6f5bc24cdec6/auto_tests/tox_test.c#L1332)):_
Previously, iphydf wrote… > Use `#if 0/#endif` instead to accommodate for source formatters. >
> Done. --- _Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/13)_

Review status: 2 of 3 files reviewed at latest revision, 7 unresolved discussions. --- _[auto_tests/tox_test.c, line 6 [r5]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/13#-KOlGtHxVaDrdpjqdJO7:-KOlKF3UqWCLQQB8CLIz:bdvlm4m) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/c91acf5790cbb935befa6dd3bd1c6f5bc24cdec6/auto_tests/tox_test.c#L6)):_ > These tests expect, and the defined timeouts depend on the speed > I think it would be better written as "These tests expect -- and the defined timeouts depend on -- the speed". Had to re-read it at least twice due to the confusion caused by the change of tense in "expect" and "defined". --- _[auto_tests/tox_test.c, line 36 [r5]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/13#-KOlGgXXSPYtiE1pCe73:-KOlL1jVXvEez9ISDVOu:b-qhzajr) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/c91acf5790cbb935befa6dd3bd1c6f5bc24cdec6/auto_tests/tox_test.c#L36)):_
Previously, GrayHatter (Gregory Mullen) wrote… > I can do that, but is' just localhost. It's only Travis that breaks ::1 while 127.0.1 works. On other systems both should work exactly the same. > > AFAICT there's no difference if you're system isn't ~broken. >
> I'm for defaulting to 127.0.0.1 and enabling ::1 through a flag, as ipv4 is more commonly used by predating ipv6, thus it's less likely to break as everything has to support it. --- _[auto_tests/tox_test.c, line 1244 [r5]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/13#-KOlGZAL7Ol7I4ajfrU0:-KOlGZAL7Ol7I4ajfrU1:brbnaqy) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/c91acf5790cbb935befa6dd3bd1c6f5bc24cdec6/auto_tests/tox_test.c#L1244)):_ > ``` C > /* We might need to run this test twice */ > if (num_peers != NUM_GROUP_TOX) { > ++test_run; > ``` What is the terminating condition for repeating test runs? It seems like you will repeat the test until it passes, i.e. the number of reruns is unbounded, which is not nice if group-chats get broken by a code change and the test never finishes running because it always fails. --- _[auto_tests/tox_test.c, line 1245 [r5]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/13#-KOlGOVI6AbWiU5C0FLp:-KOlGOVJwyt-OcjbaXw1:b92br7z) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/c91acf5790cbb935befa6dd3bd1c6f5bc24cdec6/auto_tests/tox_test.c#L1245)):_ > ``` C > if (num_peers != NUM_GROUP_TOX) { > ++test_run; > printf("\tError starting up the first group, going to restart this test. This is attempt %i\n"); > ``` You didn't pass an argument for `%i` to `printf()`. --- _[auto_tests/tox_test.c, line 1256 [r5]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/13#-KOlHMSYToB9YF6KQyuD:-KOlHMSZ_Uq7_YlYdd0J:b8dzeqa) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/c91acf5790cbb935befa6dd3bd1c6f5bc24cdec6/auto_tests/tox_test.c#L1256)):_ > ``` C > } > > ck_assert_msg(num_peers == NUM_GROUP_TOX, "\n\tBad number of group peers (pre check)." > ``` This is a useless statement, as the control flow will reach here only if `num_peers == NUM_GROUP_TOX` (it will take goto otherwise in the if statement above). --- _[auto_tests/tox_test.c, line 1332 [r5]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/13#-KOlH9U9DrUQv1dyxfa5:-KOlIBi-dKhwXLLsrXMl:bzh2itf) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/c91acf5790cbb935befa6dd3bd1c6f5bc24cdec6/auto_tests/tox_test.c#L1332)):_
Previously, GrayHatter (Gregory Mullen) wrote… > Done. >
> Why did you work on improving `many_group` test just to disable it later? There are several issues with`many_group` test I have identified that you have to fix now. --- _Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/13)_

Previously, nurupo wrote… > I'm for defaulting to 127.0.0.1 and enabling ::1 through a flag, as ipv4 is more commonly used by predating ipv6, thus it's less likely to break as everything has to support it. >
> I'd prefer it to break loudly in tests rather than eventually in production. If we can't test things reliably on travis, that's a pity, but on local tests we might catch things this way. The comment says "you're encouraged ...", so I'd suggest we make that the default. Chances are that $developer won't read this ever. --- _[auto_tests/tox_test.c, line 1332 [r5]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/13#-KOlH9U9DrUQv1dyxfa5:-KOlNAdCv6i8CFRmJW72:b-vg11xn) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/c91acf5790cbb935befa6dd3bd1c6f5bc24cdec6/auto_tests/tox_test.c#L1332)):_
Previously, nurupo wrote… > Why did you work on improving `many_group` test just to disable it later? There are several issues with`many_group` test I have identified that you have to fix now. >
> The work was done in an attempt to actually fix the test. That failed, so now we need to disable it, sadly. I hope we can enable it at some point, but right now we need _some_ tests at least. Actually, perhaps we can turn this `if 0` into an `if TEST_GROUP_CHATS` or something (maybe a better name?), enabled by default, disabled on travis? --- _[auto_tests/tox_test.c, line 5 [r6]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/13#-KOlMO6pX9Qy8zAJMMYr:-KOlMO6pX9Qy8zAJMMYs:b-bsd2ha) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/edbed3b42fa0828a7b695d9b51cb806d565f8ff3/auto_tests/tox_test.c#L5)):_ > ``` C > * Tox Tests > * > * The following tests were written with a small Tox network in mind. Therefore, > ``` 80 characters? --- _Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/13)_

commit.message:
Fix a few issues with running Toxcore tests on Travis-CI

> increased the timeout for TCP tests because per @irungentoo the network on Travis-CI can be slow sometimes

> allowed groupchats test to restart on error until timeout This had to be done because current groupchats are fundamentally broken and 3/5 times they'll 'net-split' on connect

>> Drop group chat tests, add comment to the reason

> added some debugging information to TCP tests, and a #define to force IPV6 (Travis-CI only uses IPv4 on their containers) and decreased the itr interval

> Went crazy with timeouts for Tox network stuff on Travis. Tests on TCP will still randomly fail due to timeouts. I can't reproduce on any local system. So again per @irungentoo, Travis is slow, let's offer it a short bus.

verification.payload:
tree d6f3a5c8926d0ac354935f11fe49e60ed005b155
parent 5d26ce1cf5fb88f39a762b76c528a91690783840
author Gregory Mullen (grayhatter) <greg@grayhatter.com> 1468351955 -0700
committer Gregory Mullen (grayhatter) <greg@grayhatter.com> 1470951717 -0700

Fix a few issues with running Toxcore tests on Travis-CI

> increased the timeout for TCP tests because per @irungentoo the network on Travis-CI can be slow sometimes

> allowed groupchats test to restart on error until timeout This had to be done because current groupchats are fundamentally broken and 3/5 times they'll 'net-split' on connect

>> Drop group chat tests, add comment to the reason

> added some debugging information to TCP tests, and a #define to force IPV6 (Travis-CI only uses IPv4 on their containers) and decreased the itr interval

> Went crazy with timeouts for Tox network stuff on Travis. Tests on TCP will still randomly fail due to timeouts. I can't reproduce on any local system. So again per @irungentoo, Travis is slow, let's offer it a short bus.

title: Enable, and report test status
